question.text: A plant breeder wants to obtain a superior quality maize crop. What are the sequence of events he must follow to pollinate the maize flowers with the chosen pollen?

options.text: Bagging  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Emasculation  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Dusting of pollen  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Rebagging
Emasculation  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Bagging  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Dusting of pollen  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Rebagging
Bagging  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Dusting of pollen  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Emasculation  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Rebagging

solution.text: Emasculation is performed when a flower is bisexual and we do not want the pollen from the same flower to pollinate it (self-pollination) and contaminate the results. Maize has unisexual flowers. Its female flowers don't have anther and hence emasculation process is not needed.
